Coerce an Rle or RleList object to Ranges

Source: R/ranges-construct.R
as_ranges.Rd

Coerce an Rle or RleList object to Ranges

as_ranges(.data)

Arguments

.data

a Rle() or an RleList() object.

Value

an IRanges() object if the input is an Rle() object or a GRanges() object for an RleList() object.

Details

This function is behind compute_coverage().

See also

S4Vectors::Rle(), IRanges::RleList()

Examples

x <- S4Vectors::Rle(10:1, 1:10)
as_ranges(x)

#> IRanges object with 10 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>            start       end     width |     score
#>        <integer> <integer> <integer> | <integer>
#>    [1]         1         1         1 |        10
#>    [2]         2         3         2 |         9
#>    [3]         4         6         3 |         8
#>    [4]         7        10         4 |         7
#>    [5]        11        15         5 |         6
#>    [6]        16        21         6 |         5
#>    [7]        22        28         7 |         4
#>    [8]        29        36         8 |         3
#>    [9]        37        45         9 |         2
#>   [10]        46        55        10 |         1

# must have names set
y <- IRanges::RleList(chr1 = x)
as_ranges(y)

#> GRanges object with 10 ranges and 1 metadata column:
#>        seqnames    ranges strand |     score
#>           <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> | <integer>
#>    [1]     chr1         1      * |        10
#>    [2]     chr1       2-3      * |         9
#>    [3]     chr1       4-6      * |         8
#>    [4]     chr1      7-10      * |         7
#>    [5]     chr1     11-15      * |         6
#>    [6]     chr1     16-21      * |         5
#>    [7]     chr1     22-28      * |         4
#>    [8]     chr1     29-36      * |         3
#>    [9]     chr1     37-45      * |         2
#>   [10]     chr1     46-55      * |         1
#>   -------
#>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome
